source.title: Getting Started - Introduction
source.description: Introduction to Zustand state management with hook-based API, installation instructions, creating stores using create function, binding components with selectors, avoiding context providers, and handling zombie child problems.

source.title: APIs - createStore
source.description: Vanilla store creation using createStore API with setState, getState, getInitialState, subscribe utilities, state updates for primitives, objects, arrays, immutable patterns, and troubleshooting mutation issues.

source.title: APIs - createWithEqualityFn ⚛️
source.description: React Hook creation with custom equality functions using createWithEqualityFn, enabling granular re-render control, state updates, shallow comparison patterns, external actions, subscriptions, and immutability best practices.

source.title: APIs - create ⚛️
source.description: React Hook creation using create API with state, actions, selector functions, updating primitives, objects, arrays, external actions pattern, subscribing to state updates, and troubleshooting immutability issues.

source.title: APIs - shallow
source.description: Shallow comparison utility for efficient equality checks on primitives, objects, sets, maps, top-level properties, limitations with nested structures, prototype differences, and performance optimisation patterns for state comparisons.

source.title: Getting Started - Comparison
source.description: Comparison of Zustand versus Redux, Valtio, Jotai, and Recoil, covering state models including immutable versus mutable approaches, render optimisation strategies, context providers, selectors, atom-based patterns, and architectural differences.

source.title: Guides - Advanced TypeScript Guide
source.description: Advanced TypeScript patterns including curried create syntax, type inference challenges, middleware composition with devtools and persist, StateCreator typing, higher-kinded mutators, slices pattern, dynamic replace flags, and authoring custom middlewares.

source.title: Guides - Auto Generating Selectors
source.description: Auto-generating selectors using createSelectors helper function for React and vanilla stores, reducing boilerplate, accessing state properties and actions directly, type-safe selector generation, and third-party selector libraries.

source.title: Guides - Beginner TypeScript Guide
source.description: Beginner TypeScript guide covering typed store creation, component integration, store resetting, type extraction with ExtractState, multiple selectors using useShallow, derived state, combine, devtools, persist middlewares, async actions, and multiple stores.

source.title: Guides - Connect to state with URL
source.description: Connecting Zustand state to URL hash and query parameters using custom StateStorage implementations, synchronising with localStorage, conditional URL population, building shareable URLs, and maintaining state persistence across page refreshes.

source.title: Guides - Calling actions outside a React event handler in pre React 18
source.description: Handling synchronous setState in pre-React 18 outside event handlers using unstable_batchedUpdates to prevent zombie-child effects when updating Zustand stores non-reactively.

source.title: Guides - Flux inspired practice
source.description: Flux and Redux-inspired patterns including single store architecture, immutable updates with set/setState, colocated store actions, slice patterns, redux middleware, and dispatched action reducers.

source.title: Guides - How to reset state
source.description: Resetting store state to initial values using getInitialState, single store reset patterns, multiple store reset with custom create wrapper, storeResetFns management.

source.title: Guides - Immutable state and merging
source.description: Immutable state updates with automatic shallow merging via set, nested object handling with spread operators, replace flag for disabling merge behavior, avoiding state mutation.

source.title: Guides - Initialize state with props
source.description: Dependency injection with createStore and React Context, provider implementation with useRef, custom hooks for store access, context wrapper patterns, equality function support.

source.title: Guides - Map and Set Usage
source.description: Using Map and Set immutably by creating new instances for updates, reading patterns, add/delete/clear operations, reference-based change detection, TypeScript type hints for empty collections.

source.title: Guides - Setup with Next.js
source.description: Next.js integration with per-request stores using createStore, context providers, SSR-friendly initialization, Pages Router and App Router architectures, avoiding global stores, hydration compatibility.

source.title: Guides - Practice with no store actions
source.description: Alternative pattern defining actions external to store at module level using setState, enabling code splitting and hook-free action calls versus colocated actions approach.

source.title: Guides - Prevent rerenders with useShallow
source.description: Preventing unnecessary rerenders using useShallow for shallow-equal computed state, comparing Object.is versus shallow equality checks, optimizing subscriptions when output structure remains consistent.

source.title: Guides - Slices Pattern
source.description: Modular store architecture by dividing large stores into individual slices, combining slices into bounded stores, cross-slice updates, middleware application, TypeScript usage patterns.

source.title: Guides - SSR and Hydration
source.description: Server-side rendering and hydration techniques with React, covering SSR implementation using Express and ReactDOMServer, hydration process with hydrateRoot, stateless and stateful rendering, common hydration errors, and best practices.

source.title: Guides - Testing
source.description: Testing setup with Jest and Vitest including Zustand store mocking, React Testing Library integration, component and store testing patterns, automatic state reset after tests, and comprehensive counter store examples.

source.title: Guides - Tutorial: Tic-Tac-Toe
source.description: Tic-tac-toe tutorial demonstrating React fundamentals with Zustand including state lifting, component composition, time travel implementation using history arrays, game logic with winner calculation, and immutability patterns with combine middleware.

source.title: Guides - Updating state
source.description: Updating state patterns covering flat shallow merging, deeply nested object handling with spread operators, Immer for convenient mutations, optics-ts for functional transformations, and Ramda for path-based state modifications.

source.title: Hooks - useShallow ⚛️
source.description: useShallow hook for optimising re-renders through shallow comparison memoisation, preventing unnecessary updates when derived state unchanged, demonstrated with bear family store example showing selector wrapping and performance improvements.

source.title: Hooks - useStoreWithEqualityFn ⚛️
source.description: useStoreWithEqualityFn hook for using vanilla stores in React with custom equality functions, supporting global and scoped stores, dynamic store creation, context-based patterns, and shallow comparison for granular re-render control.

source.title: Hooks - useStore ⚛️
source.description: useStore hook for integrating vanilla Zustand stores in React components, supporting global stores, dynamic store factories, scoped context-based stores, selector functions, and independent state management per component instance.

source.title: Integrations - Immer middleware
source.description: Immer middleware enabling convenient immutable state updates through mutation syntax, simplifying deeply nested object handling, requiring Immer as dependency, with gotchas regarding class objects and immerable symbol for proper subscriptions.

source.title: Integrations - Persisting store data
source.description: Persist middleware for storing Zustand state in localStorage, sessionStorage, AsyncStorage, or custom storage engines, supporting synchronous and asynchronous hydration, partialisation, version migration, custom merge functions, and Next.js SSR handling.

source.title: Integrations - Third-party Libraries
source.description: Third-party library ecosystem for Zustand including devtools, middleware for multiplayer collaboration, persistence, state synchronisation across tabs, framework adapters for Angular and Vue, time-travel debugging, computed states, and form management utilities.

source.title: Middlewares - combine
source.description: Combine middleware merges initial state with state creator function for automatic type inference, eliminates need for curried create, returns combined state creator function.

source.title: Middlewares - devtools
source.description: Redux DevTools Extension integration for time-travel debugging, action filtering with actionsDenylist, custom naming, Slices pattern support, cleanup methods, and action type labelling for enhanced debugging.

source.title: Middlewares - immer
source.description: Immer middleware enables immutable state updates without manual object copying, simplifies nested object mutations, eliminates boilerplate spreading syntax, and maintains immutability through Immer library integration.

source.title: Middlewares - persist
source.description: State persistence across page reloads using localStorage, sessionStorage, or custom storage, with partial state persistence, versioning, migration functions, deep merging, manual hydration control, and skipHydration option.

source.title: Middlewares - redux
source.description: Redux-style state updates using actions and reducers, dispatch method for action handling, reducer functions for state transformations, and Redux patterns without Redux library dependency.

source.title: Middlewares - subscribeWithSelector
source.description: Subscribe to granular state updates based on selector functions, enables partial state subscriptions, reduces unnecessary re-renders, and provides fine-grained control over state change notifications.

source.title: Migrations - Migrating to v4
source.description: Migration from v3 to v4 covering type changes in create, StateCreator, PartialState, useStore, UseBoundStore, UseContextStore, createContext, middleware type parameters, and persist partialize behavior updates.

source.title: Migrations - How to Migrate to v5 from v4
source.description: Migration from v4 to v5 covering dropped default exports, createWithEqualityFn for custom equality, useShallow hook, stable selector requirements, stricter setState types, persist middleware changes, and React 18 requirements.

source.title: Previous Versions - createContext from zustand/context
source.description: Deprecated createContext from zustand/context for store wrapping in React context, avoids store hook misuse, supports prop-based initialization, replaced by manual context pattern in v4.
